title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 830.3 - Presentation of freight bills
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 830.3 - Presentation of freight bills

State Regulations
(a) Freight
bills for all transportation charges shall be presented to the shippers within
seven calendar days from the first 12:00 midnight following delivery of the
freight. (b) Shippers may elect to
have their freight bills presented by means of the United States mails, and
when the mail service is so used the time of mailing by the carrier shall be
deemed to be the time of presentation of the bills. In case of dispute as to
the time of mailing, the postmark shall be accepted as showing such
time. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
830.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
